MatchAttribute Class

In this Article

Represents the attributes of a match made using text pattern matching. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.All)]
public sealed class MatchAttribute : Attribute

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Attribute
  • MatchAttribute

Remarks

Text pattern matching allows an XML Web service to leverage existing HTML content by parsing it using regular expressions. an XML Web service specifies the content it wants to parse in a Service Description using match elements. These match elements specify several items: the regular expression for parsing the contents of an existing HTML page, whether the parsing must be case-insensitive, and how many instances of content that matches the regular expression should be returned. When a client builds a proxy class using the Wsdl.exe tool, methods of the proxy class include a MatchAttribute detailing the match elements found in the Service Description.

For more information on text pattern matching, see [<topic://cpconcreatingclientsthatparsecontentofotherwebpages>].

Constructors summary

MatchAttribute(String)

Initializes a new instance of the MatchAttribute class with the specified pattern.

Properties summary

Capture

Gets or sets a value that represents the index of a match within a grouping.
Group

Gets or sets a value that represents a grouping of related matches.
IgnoreCase

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the pattern to match is case insensitive.
MaxRepeats

Gets or sets the maximum number of values to return from the match.
Pattern

Gets or sets a regular expression that represents the pattern to match.

Constructors

  • MatchAttribute(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the MatchAttribute class with the specified pattern.

    public MatchAttribute (string pattern);

    Parameters

    • pattern
      String

      A string that represents the pattern to match.

    Remarks

    Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the MatchAttribute class using the specified pattern.

    The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of MatchAttribute.

    Property Initial Value
    Pattern The value of the pattern parameter.

    Example

    public class Example_Headers 
{    
	[MatchAttribute("TITLE>(.*?)<")]
	public string Title;
        
	[MatchAttribute("", Pattern="h1>(.*?)<", IgnoreCase=true)]
	public string H1;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?)+)<", Group=3, Capture=4)] 
	public string Element;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=0)] 
	public string[] Elements1;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=1)] 
	public string[] Elements2;

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=1)]
	public string Attribute;

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=2)]
	public string Value;
}

    
Public Class Headers

    Public Title As String

    <MatchAttribute("", Pattern:="h1>(.*?)<", IgnoreCase:=True)> _
    Public H1 As String

    Public Elements1() As String

    <MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group:=3, MaxRepeats:=1)> _
    Public Elements2() As String

    <MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group:=1)> _
    Public Attribute As String

    Public Value As String
End Class 'Headers

{

   [MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?)+)<",Group=3,Capture=4)]

   [MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<",Group=3,MaxRepeats=0)]
   array<String^>^ Elements1;

   [MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<",Group=3,MaxRepeats=1)]
   array<String^>^ Elements2;

   [MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)",Group=1)]
   String^ Attribute;

   [MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)",Group=2)]
   String^ Value;
};

  • Group

    Gets or sets a value that represents a grouping of related matches.

    public int Group { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      A value that represents a grouping of related matches

    Remarks

    Use the Group property to specify a group that a match belongs to.

    Example

    public class Example_Headers 
{

	public string Title;
        
	[MatchAttribute("", Pattern="h1>(.*?)<", IgnoreCase=true)]

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=0)]

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=1)]

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=1)]
	public string Attribute;

	public string Value;
}

  • IgnoreCase

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the pattern to match is case insensitive.

    public bool IgnoreCase { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if matching is case insensitive; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

    Example

    public class Example_Headers 
{    
	[MatchAttribute("TITLE>(.*?)<")]
	public string Title;
        
	[MatchAttribute("", Pattern="h1>(.*?)<", IgnoreCase=true)]
	public string H1;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?)+)<", Group=3, Capture=4)] 
	public string Element;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=0)] 
	public string[] Elements1;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=1)] 
	public string[] Elements2;

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=1)]
	public string Attribute;

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=2)]
	public string Value;
}

   String^ Value;

  • MaxRepeats

    Gets or sets the maximum number of values to return from the match.

    public int MaxRepeats { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum number of values to return from the match. The default value is -1, which refers to returning all values.

    Remarks

    A value of 1 returns only the first match. A value of -1 returns all matches. Additionally, a value of -1 equates to an '*' in a regular expression.

    Example

    public class Example_Headers 
{    
	[MatchAttribute("TITLE>(.*?)<")]
	public string Title;
        
	[MatchAttribute("", Pattern="h1>(.*?)<", IgnoreCase=true)]
	public string H1;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?)+)<", Group=3, Capture=4)] 
	public string Element;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=0)] 
	public string[] Elements1;

	[MatchAttribute("H2>((([^<,]*),?){2,})<", Group=3, MaxRepeats=1)] 
	public string[] Elements2;

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=1)]
	public string Attribute;

	[MatchAttribute("H3 ([^=]*)=([^>]*)", Group=2)]
	public string Value;
}

    Public Attribute As String

    Public Value As String
End Class 'Headers
